thread.title: Stand-in stands out in otherwise uninspired ‘Magic Flute’
thread.title_full: Stand-in stands out in otherwise uninspired ‘Magic Flute’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Joshua Kosman
title: Stand-in stands out in otherwise uninspired ‘Magic Flute’
text:
Photo: Franchon Smith, The Chronicle The Three ladies, left to right, Zanda Svede, Nian Wang and Jacqueline Piccolino, stand over Paul Appleby as Tamino, during the dress rehearsal of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's The Magic Flute at the War Memorial Opera House on October 17, 2015. The Three ladies, left to right, Zanda Svede, Nian Wang and...
The expression “too soon” is usually applied to tasteless topical jokes, but it serves equally well for operatic productions. On Tuesday night, just three years after its premiere at the War Memorial Opera House, the San Francisco Opera revived designer Jun Kaneko’s colorful, broad version of Mozart’s “Magic Flute.” The Three ladies, left to right, Zanda Svede, Nian Wang and Jacqueline Piccolino, stand over Paul Appleby as Tamino, during the dress rehearsal of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's The Magic Flute at the War Memorial Opera House on October 17, 2015. The Three ladies, left to right, Zanda Svede, Nian Wang and...
The expression “too soon” is usually applied to tasteless topical jokes, but it serves equally well for operatic productions. On Tuesday night, just three years after its premiere at the War Memorial Opera House, the San Francisco Opera revived designer Jun Kaneko’s colorful, broad version of Mozart’s “Magic Flute.”
